name: Hector
title: Greek - Hector
role: Champion of Troy, Defender of the City, Greatest Trojan Warrior
summary: Hector, tamer of horses, eldest son of Priam and Hecuba, stands as Troy's greatest champion and the noblest figure in Homer's Iliad. Unlike the wrathful Achilles, Hector embodies civic duty, fighting not for glory but for his city, his parents, and his family. His farewell to Andromache and infant Astyanax remains one of literature's most poignant scenes. His death at Achilles' hands and Priam's ransom of his body conclude the Iliad.
description: Hector, tamer of horses, is the greatest warrior of Troy and son of King Priam. In Homer's Iliad, he defends his city against the Greek invasion, kills Patroclus, and falls to Achilles in their final duel. His nobility, love for family, and sense of duty make him the most sympathetic figure on either side of the war.

homeric_context.role_in_epic: Troy's greatest champion, antagonist to Achilles, most noble figure in the poem
key_books: Book 24 - His funeral concludes the Iliad

quests: Defended Troy against the Greek invasion for ten years
Led the Trojans in pushing Greeks back to their ships
Slew Patroclus while wearing Achilles' armor
Faced Achilles in single combat, knowing he would die
feats: Led Trojan assault that nearly burned the Greek ships
Killed Protesilaus, first Greek to land at Troy
Defended Troy for a decade against the Greek army

wife: Andromache - their farewell is the most touching scene in the Iliad
son: Astyanax (Scamandrius) - later thrown from Troy's walls by the Greeks
siblings: Paris (whose abduction of Helen caused the war)

death.description: Slain by Achilles in single combat outside the walls of Troy
death.circumstances: Athena disguised as Deiphobus tricked Hector into standing and fighting
death.aftermath: Achilles dragged his body behind his chariot for twelve days
death.ransom: Priam ransomed his body for burial - the Iliad ends with his funeral

cross_cultural_parallels.name: Bhishma (noble warrior who fights for the wrong side)
